Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Thanks,

I don't think we should rename the file here. This could break deployments that have the later. right?

Patch Set 2:

Also, could you file a lite-spec for this? 

Create a bug and tag it as Wishlist, we'll do the rest

Patch Set 2:

>>I don't think we should rename the file here. This could >>break deployments that have the later. right?
Flavio,
The reason to rename was because these metadata are support for both flavor extra spec and image properties. Adding to same file will mislead because it indicates only flavor.

I can retain the old file but the cpu properties will be redundant. Any suggestions?

I created a lite-spec. Will update shortly
Uploaded patch set 3.

Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I think your change is good. I have a few suggestions and question.

1. So, I would recommend adding a UpgradeImpact flag (this surely will need doc info for ops while moving to Mitaka)  and let's create a release note for & in this commit. Please take a look at http://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/release-management.html#how-to-add-new-release-notes and the next section for information on how to do that.


--

Below questions only for knowledge sharing (if you are ok). I want to identify more where and how metadefs are being used.

2. I prolly need to re-read the spec, but if you can give a tl;dr on why these properties have nova flavor and glance associations at the same time? My next question ties into this.

3. Are these properties protected for your operations? (esp If they are related to nova flavors.)
Uploaded patch set 4.

Patch Set 4:

>>2. I prolly need to re-read the spec, but if you can >>give a tl;dr on why these properties have nova flavor and >>glance associations at the same time? My next question >>ties into this.
Thanks for the review!
Consider a scenario where same image is used for demo, dev and test environments. The resource requirements for these environments can be different. It requires same image to be uploaded thrice along with their own image metadata values. In such cases, flavor metadata for VMware resource allocation can be useful. In a production environment, in order to meet the SLA guarantees, admin can define image metadata based on the workload performance. This image metadata always takes precendence over flavor extra spec.

3. Are these properties protected for your operations? (esp If they are related to nova flavors.)
Yes, these properties are protected. Since property protection is operator specific, I haven't submitted that file..
Uploaded patch set 5.

Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

The Nova patch to use the proposed image meta is yet to be merged https://review.openstack.org/#/c/180942/.  Thanks to Giri for confirming the same.

Kindly update us when the Nova patch merges and we will be happy to consider it again.

will update the patch along with dependency note on the nova patch.
Uploaded patch set 8.

Patch Set 8: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.

Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

This patch has been -1ed because it has not been updated in
>=2months. The patch also has either a -1/-2 from a core reviewer or a
-1 from Jenkins.

Please, update/rebase the patch if the lack of updates was actually a
lack of reviews or if you think the patch is still relevant.

**NOTE: This will be abandoned if no update is done in 1 week.**

If this action does not seem accurate, please, ping flaper87 on IRC
and he will gladly revert it. Sorry for the inconvenience and we look
forward to have more contributions from you.

Patch Set 8:

This patch was marked to be abanadoned >=7days ago.

It is now being abandoned because there was no update, feedback nor rebase in the aforementioned period. If this is a mistake, please, contact members of the glance team[0] and they'll promptly correct the error.

Thanks for your contribution. The Glance team looks forward to new contributions from you.
Abandoned
